# keyboard Short Cuts and Linux commands for Coding

A summary of linux commands that I use for coding in python

## Keyboard Shortcuts for Terminal

There are many over lapping keyboard shortcuts between the terminal and vscode. I recommend learning the over lapping ones.


|  shortcut |description   |
|---|---|
| Ctrl + a  | goto beginning of line  |
| Fnc + ←| goto beginning of line|
| Ctrl + e   | goto end of line  |
| Fnc + →| goto end of line|
| Ctrl + w  |  delete one word backwards |
| Ctrl + k | remove cursor to beginning of line|
| Ctrl + u | remove cursor to end of line|
| Ctrl + y|  undone |
| Ctrl + Shift + c| copy to terminal |
| Ctrl + Shift + v| paste to terminal |
| Ctrl + F| move one forward|

## Keyboard shortcuts for Vscode on Linux

### Navigation Within a File

| Shortcut |description   |
|---    |---      |
|Ctrl+C | copy |
|Ctrl+v | paste |
|Ctrl+x | cut line|
|Ctrl+⬆ | move view up|
|Ctrl+⬇ | move view down|
|Alt+⬆  | move line up|
|Alt+⬇  | move line down|
|Fnc+⬆  | move to top of page|
|Fnc+⬇  | move to bottom of page|
|Ctrl+] | indent line |
|Ctrl+[ | out dent line |
|Alt+Z  | toggle word wrap|
|Ctrl+F | find |
|Ctrl+H | replace |

You can define custom shortcuts but learn the default ones first. When you go to different computer you will have to reprogram the shortcuts.

### Using Vscode Functionality

| Shortcut |description   |
|---    |---      |
|Ctrl+P | quick open  a file |
|Ctrl+Shift+A | toggle block command|
|Ctrl+Shift+P |  show command palette|
|Fnc+F11| full screen |
|Ctrl+d| select word|
|Shift+Ctrl+→/←| select words left or right|
|Shift+Alt+→/←| smart select|
